file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 30-11-04-04 - PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCHES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCHES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-30-0026 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the piccolo pressure-drop switches of the Wing Thermal Anti-Icing System. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH piccolo pressure-drop switches. C. The LH piccolo pressure-drop switch is installed on the LH side of the forward lower fairing. D. The RH piccolo pressure-drop switch is installed on the RH side of the forward lower fairing. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PRE-MOD. S.B. PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH - 30-11-04-000-801-A 145-30-0026 REMOVAL PRE-MOD. S.B. PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH - 30-11-04-400-801-A 145-30-0026 INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 30-11-04 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-11-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-30-0026 2. PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the piccolo pressure-drop switch of the Wing Thermal Anti-Icing System. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - S.B.145-30-0019 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 511 511AL LH side of the forward lower fairing 611 611AR RH side of the forward lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH side of the forward lower fairing 1 Helps the other technician LH or RH side of the forward lower fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the WING circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. • WING: (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/ICE AND RAIN PROTECTION/WING). (2) Remove access panel 511AL or 611AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Remove the landing light lens. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-11-04 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Applicable only to aircraft PRE-MOD. S.B.145-30-0019. (a) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (b) Disconnect the tubes (3) and (6). (c) Remove the nut (5) and washer (4). (d) Remove the piccolo pressure-drop switch (2) from the support (7). (2) Applicable only to aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-30-0019. (a) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (b) Disconnect the tube (5). (c) Remove the nut (4) and washer (3). (d) Remove the piccolo pressure-drop switch (2) from the supports (6) and (7). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-11-04 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. TUBE (TYPICAL) 2. PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 2. PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP 7. SUPPORT SWITCH 4. WASHER 5. NUT 6. TUBE 7. SUPPORT 6. SUPPORT 3. WASHER 4. NUT 5. TUBE 1 DET. B (TYPICAL) 1 PRE-MOD S.B. 145-30-0019 2 DET. B (TYPICAL) 2 POST-MOD S.B. 145-30-0019 145AMM300037.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-11-04 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-11-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-30-0026 3. PICCOLO PRESSURE-DROP SWITCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the piccolo pressure-drop switch of the Wing Thermal Anti-Icing System. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - S.B.145-30-0019 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 511 511AL LH side of the forward lower fairing 611 611AR RH side of the forward lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH side of the forward lower fairing 1 Helps the other technician LH or RH side of the forward lower fairing I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Applicable only to aircraft PRE-MOD. S.B.145-30-0019. (a) Put the piccolo pressure-drop switch (2) on the support (7). (b) Install the washer (4) and nut (5) to attach the piccolo pressure-drop switch (2) to the support (7). (c) Connect the tubes (3) and (6). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-11-04 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (d) Connect the electrical connector (1). (2) Applicable only to aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-30-0019. (a) Put the piccolo pressure-drop switch (2) on the supports (6) and (7). (b) Install the washer (3) and nut (4) to attach the piccolo pressure-drop switch (2) to the support (6). (c) Connect the tube (5). (d) Connect the electrical connector (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the WING circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. • WING: (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/ICE AND RAIN PROTECTION/WING). (2) Examine the tube connections for leaks. (3) Install access panel 511AL or 611AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) Install the landing light lens.
